title: Gun recovered in teen shooting
content:
NATCHITOCHES, La. - A gun in the possession of the teenager who was shot and killed in the parking lot of a Natchitoches convenience store Sunday has been recovered by police.
Just before 3 p.m. Sunday, officers with the Natchitoches Police Department responded to 1205 Texas Street (Super Stop) in reference to a shooting.
There, they found the juvenile shot multiple times in the parking lot, identified to NBC6 reporter Jeane' Franseen as Louis Byrd III by his mother, Termisha Byrd,
A man at the scene, Melvin Pye Jr., 21, remained there and notified the Natchitoches Police Department that he was approached by a juvenile who had a firearm in his possession.
The juvenile was shot several times while in the parking lot, and was in possession of the 7.62x39 mm caliber AK-47 style firearm.
The juvenile was transported to the Natchitoches Regional Medical Center where he was pronounced deceased from his wounds.
No charges will be filed at this time and there will be no further press releases or information disseminated until the District Attorney’s Office has the opportunity to review the case.
Anyone with additional information in regard to this investigation please contact Detective William Connell at (318) 238-3914.
